item.title:
We provided grants to 10 teams who developed innovative prototypes for using democratic input to help define AI system behavior.
Read about our learnings and how we'll put this work into practice. https://openai.com/blog/democratic-inputs-to-ai-grant-program-update

item.title:
Snapshot of how we’re preparing for 2024’s worldwide elections:
• Working to prevent abuse, including misleading deepfakes • Providing transparency on AI-generated content • Improving access to authoritative voting information https://openai.com/blog/how-openai-is-approaching-2024-worldwide-elections
item.content:encoded:
Snapshot of how we’re preparing for 2024’s worldwide elections:

• Working to prevent abuse, including misleading deepfakes
• Providing transparency on AI-generated content
• Improving access to authoritative voting information

item.title:
Introducing ChatGPT Team: A new plan for teams of all sizes with access to advanced models and tools, business-grade data privacy & security, and the ability to create and share custom GPTs.
Upgrade from your ChatGPT account. https://openai.com/blog/introducing-chatgpt-team

item.title:
We build AI to empower people, including journalists.
Our position on the @nytimes lawsuit: • Training is fair use, but we provide an opt-out • "Regurgitation" is a rare bug we're driving to zero • The New York Times is not telling the full story https://openai.com/blog/openai-and-journalism
item.content:encoded:
We build AI to empower people, including journalists.

Our position on the @nytimes lawsuit:
• Training is fair use, but we provide an opt-out
• "Regurgitation" is a rare bug we're driving to zero
• The New York Times is not telling the full story
openai.com/blog/openai-and-j…

item.title:
R to @OpenAI: The AJP’s Product & AI Studio was created to help guide local news organizations in using AI tools effectively for accessible, high-quality journalism, and to share key learnings across the journalism industry at large.
AJP is growing its Studio team. https://www.theajp.org/about/work-with-us/
item.content:encoded:
The AJP’s Product & AI Studio was created to help guide local news organizations in using AI tools effectively for accessible, high-quality journalism, and to share key learnings across the journalism industry at large.

AJP is growing its Studio team.
theajp.org/about/work-with-u…

item.title: Through our partnership with @JournalismProj, its new Product & AI Studio has selected the first cohort of newsrooms to receive grants— enabling 13 organizations to pilot and experiment with a variety of AI applications to assist local journalism. https://medium.com/american-journalism-project/exploring-emerging-technologies-an-update-on-our-product-ai-studio-423d4bb38383
item.content:encoded: Through our partnership with @JournalismProj, its new Product & AI Studio has selected the first cohort of newsrooms to receive grants— enabling 13 organizations to pilot and experiment with a variety of AI applications to assist local journalism. medium.com/american-journali…

item.title:
You can now archive your chats in ChatGPT!
Archive removes chats from your sidebar without deleting them. You can see your archived chats in Settings.
Currently available on Web and iOS with Android coming soon.
item.content:encoded:
You can now archive your chats in ChatGPT!

Archive removes chats from your sidebar without deleting them. You can see your archived chats in Settings.

Currently available on Web and iOS with Android coming soon.

item.title: R to @OpenAI: We encourage you to read the full Preparedness Framework (Beta) here for more detail. This is a living document, and we expect to regularly update it as we learn more. https://cdn.openai.com/openai-preparedness-framework-beta.pdf
item.content:encoded: We encourage you to read the full Preparedness Framework (Beta) here for more detail. This is a living document, and we expect to regularly update it as we learn more. cdn.openai.com/openai-prepar…

item.title: R to @OpenAI: In our safety baselines, only models with a post-mitigation score of medium or below can be deployed, and only models with a post-mitigation score of high or below can be developed further. We also increase security protections commensurate with model risk.
item.content:encoded: In our safety baselines, only models with a post-mitigation score of medium or below can be deployed, and only models with a post-mitigation score of high or below can be developed further. We also increase security protections commensurate with model risk.

item.title: R to @OpenAI: Our new safety baselines and governance process will turn these technical findings into safety decisions for model development and deployment. This involves establishing a cross-functional Safety Advisory Group to make safety recommendations.
item.content:encoded: Our new safety baselines and governance process will turn these technical findings into safety decisions for model development and deployment. This involves establishing a cross-functional Safety Advisory Group to make safety recommendations.

item.title: R to @OpenAI: Our Preparedness Team will drive technical work, pushing the limits of our cutting edge models to run evaluations and closely monitor risks, including during training runs. Results will be synthesized in scorecards that track model risk.
item.content:encoded: Our Preparedness Team will drive technical work, pushing the limits of our cutting edge models to run evaluations and closely monitor risks, including during training runs. Results will be synthesized in scorecards that track model risk.

item.title: We are systemizing our safety thinking with our Preparedness Framework, a living document (currently in beta) which details the technical and operational investments we are adopting to guide the safety of our frontier model development. https://openai.com/safety/preparedness
item.content:encoded:
We are systemizing our safety thinking with our Preparedness Framework, a living document (currently in beta) which details the technical and operational investments we are adopting to guide the safety of our frontier model development.
openai.com/safety/preparedne…

item.title:
Our new research white paper identifies seven practices for keeping increasingly agentic AI systems safe and accountable as they become more common and more capable.
We are providing research grants for work on a range of open questions. https://openai.com/research/practices-for-governing-agentic-ai-systems
item.content:encoded:
Our new research white paper identifies seven practices for keeping increasingly agentic AI systems safe and accountable as they become more common and more capable.

We are providing research grants for work on a range of open questions. openai.com/research/practice…

item.title:
R to @OpenAI: There is lots of low-hanging fruit and many promising directions for future work. We think this is an exciting opportunity for the ML research community.
To kickstart more research, we're launching $10M in grants: https://x.com/OpenAI/status/1735347884718211562?s=20
item.content:encoded:
There is lots of low-hanging fruit and many promising directions for future work. We think this is an exciting opportunity for the ML research community.

To kickstart more research, we're launching $10M in grants: x.com/OpenAI/status/17353478…

nitter.cz/OpenAI/status/1735347884718211562#m

item.title:
R to @OpenAI: Naive weak supervision isn't enough—current techniques, like RLHF, won't be sufficient for future superhuman models.
But we also show that it's feasible to drastically improve weak-to-strong generalization—making iterative empirical progress on a core challenge of superalignment
item.content:encoded:
Naive weak supervision isn't enough—current techniques, like RLHF, won't be sufficient for future superhuman models.

But we also show that it's feasible to drastically improve weak-to-strong generalization—making iterative empirical progress on a core challenge of superalignment

item.title:
R to @OpenAI: Large pretrained models have excellent raw capabilities—but can we elicit these fully with only weak supervision?
GPT-4 supervised by ~GPT-2 recovers performance close to GPT-3.5 supervised by humans—generalizing to solve even hard problems where the weak supervisor failed!
item.content:encoded:
Large pretrained models have excellent raw capabilities—but can we elicit these fully with only weak supervision?

GPT-4 supervised by ~GPT-2 recovers performance close to GPT-3.5 supervised by humans—generalizing to solve even hard problems where the weak supervisor failed!

item.title:
In the future, humans will need to supervise AI systems much smarter than them.
We study an analogy: small models supervising large models.
Read the Superalignment team's first paper showing progress on a new approach, weak-to-strong generalization: https://openai.com/research/weak-to-strong-generalization
item.content:encoded:
In the future, humans will need to supervise AI systems much smarter than them.

We study an analogy: small models supervising large models.

Read the Superalignment team's first paper showing progress on a new approach, weak-to-strong generalization: openai.com/research/weak-to-…

item.title:
R to @OpenAI: Figuring out how to ensure future superhuman AI systems are aligned and safe is one of the most important unsolved technical problems in the world. But we think it is a solvable problem.
There is lots of low-hanging fruit, and new researchers can make enormous contributions!
item.content:encoded:
Figuring out how to ensure future superhuman AI systems are aligned and safe is one of the most important unsolved technical problems in the world. But we think it is a solvable problem.

There is lots of low-hanging fruit, and new researchers can make enormous contributions!
